message: Looks like the Necronomicon isn't in the archives after all.
Other than that, if we're talking about rooms we should check out in the Archives......
Dorothy isn't at the reception.
I don't know where you're loafing around, but is it really okay to leave the reception unattended for this long?
Dorothy isn't at the reception in front of the Archives.
Usually I'd scold her for being lazy, but today it's actually better that she's not here.
This is the front desk of the Archives.
The floor is made of marble, but it seems to be quite old and not well taken care of, so it's been a long time since it lost its characteristic shine.
The door in the back probably leads to what used to be inside the university.
I don't know how many collectibles there are, but it's highly unlikely that what's inside is better than how it looks.
At the back of the room, there's a door that leads to the library.
Ever since I snuck into the dean's office before, Dorothy hasn't even let me into the library, but now I can slip in quietly.
There's not a very high chance the Necronomicon is in the library, but I can't exactly not check.
For an archives in a lonely, rundown rural backwater, it's a pretty impressive building.
The only pity is that the villagers and officials don't seem all that eager to preserve this building.
It looks like an index card made to answer questions about book collections and various other collectibles.
But with absolutely no tourists visiting the village, and the villagers themselves being totally indifferent to their own village's history, I can't really say it's having much effect.
Neatly arranged index cards are set up across the entire wall. If this woman named Dorothy is managing all of them by herself, she must be pretty meticulous.
The counter that's been used for ages has lost its shine, gotten dark and dingy, and now it's basically just worthless junk.
Back when this building was still a university, this was just a hall where students gathered, so it probably isn’t all that old.
She must have been treated really roughly for a long time.
Dorothy's nowhere to be seen.
Their meticulousness is so extreme that not even a trace is left to show they were ever there, which ironically backfires and makes it seem like they're always skipping out on work to goof off.
In reality, Dorothy is just a timid office lady, and the reason she's strict with rule breakers is because she doesn't want to get caught up in the fallout herself.
The top of the counter is neatly arranged, and there's nothing on it that gives away any hint of Dorothy's personality.
In the Archives that hardly anyone uses, I wonder how she kills the boring hours.
Archive
President's Office
Go outside
